intro: Pentapyxis stipulata, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has compound leaves with stipules, which are small, leaf-like structures at the base of the leaf stalks. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Pentapyxis stipulata is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
